WRITING.TEXT: 9-10, less than that and im a bit tired

I can only talk for myself, but Im afraid of getting better because being like this is all i know. I feel like getting better is a good thing, but the process scares me, because i have to let go of bad coping mechanisms that i #8217;ve had as long as i can remember. Letting go of cutting, throwing up, eating disorder, etc is like letting go of a mother. Those things have always been there for me when i was alone, scared, and so on. So im afraid that if i let go, they will leave empty hole in me and i #8217;ll be alone.

I feel the same way, im not addicted to cutting. Sometimes im even years without doing it. I cut when i feel like it, usually when i see no reason not to do so. I dont cut myself in dangerous places, not too deep, and self care is maybe the thing i love the most. And i can always stop myself from doing it if i need to. The urge to cut is kinda similar as when i feel like i want sugar or something. The urge usually comes if im very stressed, again similar to sugar cravings. I also dont count days or anything.

Yes! Im on a retirement or something because of my mental health problems. My life was stable when i was single, had no friends, only people i saw were my therapist and family, but i felt like i had no meaning. I was sort of happy, i exercised a lot, ate well, had good structure on my days but still something was missing. But now im planning to start online classes, im in one group thing, im in a serious relationship and even have one friend who reached out to me and im so miserable i started self harming again. If im alone life feels meaningless, if im with people i feel like im dying. Im so sick of this.

Actually the opposite. I have avpd and bpd, and it doesnt show outside. I always hear how nice i am. In school i was the happy, funny, friendly one. I have good #8221;people skills #8221;, i can read people pretty well and so on. But it doesnt come like #8221;naturally #8221;, for example i tell people about myself not when i feel like it, but when i feel like they want me to. And i dont comfort and hug crying friend because i feel i want to, but because i feel like that #8217;s what they want me to do. It #8217;s all an act when im with people, all my own opinions and needs disappear and i just exist for them.

Not really. I #8217;ve been 6 years in therapy and made a lot of progress, but not with avoidance. I mean im very approachable (sadly) because that #8217;s a role i have been building for my whole life so if i have to be with people i can act like it #8217;s nice, but i still am very avoidant in a big picture.

Same! And my mask is so good people think i actually like being with people. Even people who know i have avpd have said how nice it was to see me enjoying being with people, even though i didnt enjoy it. So exhausting, and i dont know how to stop. It just automatically goes on when i see people. Personally i dont enjoy having friends. I dont want them, yet they always come from somewhere. They tell me how nice it is to be so close and im there not feeling anything, pretending like i too feel like they do.

If im alone for a long time, like days at home alone, my self esteem is fragile yes but self hate is not that big. Im doing okay. I even find things i like about myself. When i see people, my self esteem drops to super low and i cant believe how something this disgusting can exist.
Yes. It drives me mad. I think it #8217;s because it kinda feels like they #8217;re belittling my problems, like saying im only angry or upset because i havent eaten.

Im actually exactly like that, but i dont feel like im wrongly diagnosed, i just have other diagnoses that kinda explain why my borderline is shaped like that. And personality disorders look different on different people, i think it #8217;s very rare to have 100% matching to all the criteria.
Yessss and yes then i lash out to myself for being needy
I have avpd, ptsd, eating disorder, and depression
Yes

I have almost the same situation actually. We #8217;ve been together like a year and he has seen my old self harm scars. i #8217;ve been clean for like two years and now i cut again. I dont plan on telling him, because im afraid how he will react. He reacts pretty strongly when im sad, he is more careful around me etc so i dont want him to know i cut myself. I think he know though, i cut small cuts on my legs and arms and say it #8217;s from shaving but i dont think he believes it. I still want to lie because people sometimes believe what they want to believe, so i hope he chooses to believe im telling the truth. I feel like it #8217;s not his problem or his battle, and telling him would only make both of us more stressed so.

Yes, i even have few #8221;storylines #8221; i come back to, like made up people and world etc. Sometimes i make new ones, but usually it #8217;s the one that i #8217;ve had since i was 11 i think, and im 25 now. I think it #8217;s weird that i usually always have someone in those as a father figure, but never a mom figure. And those #8221;storyworlds #8221; were always where i went as a kid when i needed to be comforted, i never went to my real parents or like a friend. I still do it that way though. Sometimes it #8217;s just small scenes i do over and over, and sometimes whole stories i also do over and over a bit differently. Im also aware of my surroundings but still not really there. I work well on autopilotic.

I have kinda this role that is friendly, happy, and interesting. People believe that #8217;s me. And it changes when im with different people, i can usually sense what they like and be more like that. Some like when im a bit shy, some that im very #8221;extroverted #8221; and so on. But when im alone i know it #8217;s all just an act and i have no clue who i am or what i like. I dont have favorite foods or anything, my whole identity depends on who im with at that moment. When im alone im just kinda empty. I think it #8217;s the bpd part in me too that causes this.

6 years of therapy has helped with depression, eating disorder, and stuff like controlling avpd and bpd and being aware of them. But i have no clue who i am, it kinda changes when im with different people and when im alone im just empty or full of mostly negative feelings. Everything i do and like, or dislike and dont do, is linked to my personality disorders. But i have identities, problem is they arent really me, they #8217;re like roles made to please other people and survive without people noticing how weird and empty i am.

It #8217;s weird because i think that #8217;s common in bpd like being impulsive and stuff but i dont do that. I have kinda ghosted my friends like three years ago but i dont regret it at all (probably because of my avpd) and only thing im worried is them coming back.
DAE have bpd and avpd?
Yes!

Yes. Doesnt help that my ex always used to be a lot more nicer to me after he had abused me. And my current bf cheated me and i could tell because one day he was suddenly super nice. It #8217;s suspicious when people are nice, especially more nice than usually. I feel like if people are with you for long time, they take you for granted and only shame or guilt will make them appreciate you. So obviously i get excited when im being mistreated nowdays, it means there #8217;s a treat coming lol. Im still wondering what my friend did five years ago when she insisted she wanted to buy my meal when we were at a restaurant. Also randoms who say nice things - i cry after that, i feel like i lied to them and they think im good and nice even though im horrible and ugly.

Opposite, i wake up in tears and when it #8217;s like 9pm i start usually getting happier and happier because i dont have to be with people. I used to stay up all night just because it #8217;s the only time i felt happy. But that #8217;s the avpd in me i think. Day is more bpd time and it sucks.

Yes, and to me #8221;im there for you #8221; means absolutely nothing. If i feel like i want to cut myself, talking to someone makes me want to do it more. There #8217;s nothing they can say to help. Absolutely nothing. No amount of empathy is going to make me feel better. I feel like i feel and people only make it worse, or are neutral to the situation. #8221;Im there for you #8221; only means they have no clue about my situation, and i always end up faking like it helps so i dont make them feel bad. They have this fantasy about how im sick and if they give me nice words im supposed to be better. That #8217;s not how it goes, and eventually like you said they see it and dont bother to help anymore. They mean it in a good way so i dont want to hurt them by telling how it #8217;s not helpful. I honestly dont care if they understand, because that also doesnt help. Empathy and understanding only means they also feel bad, how is that supposed to help me with my feeling?

For me to be left alone for a while is most helpful. Im seeing a professional, so im not alone with my problems even if i dont discuss about them with my friends and family. But i think some people also feel better if someone is with them but they dont talk, i think you should ask your friend what they prefer.
My doorknob is more like hand grenade.

I have one, because my therapist said that petting like a stuffed animal can help to calm down. It works and i even sleep next to it usually. Im kinda minimalist so even though i #8217;ve always liked stuffed animals, i didnt have them as an adult because i want to have as small amount of stuff as possible. But when my therapist talked about it i finally got like a real reason to have one.

Same. And for me it doesnt matter if those people are like me, i still cant connect with them. I have and have had friends, who tell me im their closest friend and how they feel like our friendship is special and it scares me, because though im aware i #8217;ve seen them a lot i dont feel any kind of #8221;connection #8221; there. I feel very guilty about this, and im usually angry, sad, feeling alone etc after seeing my friends. Even though we have nice time, laugh a bit, etc. They #8217;re not close to me. I feel like my feelings are somehow wrong and broken.

Are you still in touch or friends with your ex? If so, I think you need to think again if it #8217;s actually healthy for you to be friends with them if you still have feelings. My ex lied to me that he was over me and he wasnt. It was very painful for him, and was not healthy for either of us. (We both have bpd.) Im sorry for your situation, and i understand letting go is one of the worst and hardest things there is, but in my experience staying friends with someone you still have feelings for is pretty much torture. It breaks you over and over again.

For me doctors actually have told that at least meds that i #8217;ve taken, they #8217;re expected to make you worse for the first two weeks. Not for everyone, but for most people. So i agree, if you start meds take them long enough to see if they help and talk to your doctor about how you feel. I know it #8217;s frustrating, that #8217;s why i always wrote my diary so i could keep track of when i started the meds and how i #8217;ve felt, because if i have like two bad days in a row i go to the mood of #8221;i #8217;ve been feeling this way my whole life #8221; and then i read my diary and see i actually was doing pretty okay two or three days ago lol. Something happens to your brain when you get depressed, the memory isnt working as it should.

WRITING.TITLE: I cant #8221;connect #8221; with people.
WRITING.TEXT: I have and have had a lot of friends. I can tell they feel a connection, or like they feel they #8217;re close to me, some have even said it, but i dont feel the same. Some i #8217;ve known since i was a child, some only like few years. We have fun, share stuff, etc, but still feels like they #8217;re miles away and i dont feel this closeness that other people describe they feel. I hug them because i know when they want to, but i dont like it. I listen to their problems and show empathy, but it #8217;s like a role. I honestly dont care about their problems, and i feel guilty about that. If i never saw them again, i would not be sad, more like relieved. After i see them i usually feel alone and sad, then guilt about not feeling like they do, then shame and anger. I usually cut, throw up, etc after seeing them to punish myself for not feeling #8221;like i should #8221;, and get rid of the guilt and shame. Anyone else feel the same?

Thing is i can kinda relate to them. We have a lot in common, similar interests, even shared childhood with couple of them, etc. I still dont feel close to them. And i never have felt close, even as a child when we played together and had even more things in common. If i feel like someone understands me, feels bad for me, is nice to me, etc, i dont feel anything, or i feel shame, anger, something negative.

That #8217;s exactly the thing though, im doing everything right, yet emotionally i have no friends. I see people saying they wish they had friends who understand and are there for them etc so they could finally be happy. I #8217;ve acchieved that. And yet it doesnt help me at all. How is it even supposed to be helpful?

Yes, i delete even those where no one knows me, i #8217;ve been in reddit for like idk maybe over a year and i #8217;ve had four accounts. I just like to disappear and like #8221;create #8221; myself again. I havent had facebook, insta, etc in like 6-10 years. Only places where i can be anonymous. I do it because i start to feel so much shame for who and what i am that i have to #8221;delete my existence #8221; as much as i can. And i cant kill myself so i can at least disappear in social media.

I do actually think you #8217;re right, i mean i know i have to interact with people but i feel like having friends is not for everyone. Or at least not now for me, maybe if my therapy will continue being successfull then some day but right now friends dont bring anything good to my life.
Only she knows.

Thing is, you cant really help her. She needs professional help. If she has that, good, if she doesnt, you should tell her to get it. You can indeed leave her alone if only reason for you to stay is because you want to help her or take care of her. You cant cure someone with bpd (or whatever it is they have) they need professional help. Always being there for them JUST because you want to save them can make them worse, if they choose you over actual help. So be her friend, if she wants to. But only if you are cabable having an actual friendship, not some parent-child or doctor-patient relationship because that #8217;s what it kinda sounds like you have / want to have. You already said it effects your job, and gives you anxiety - that is not healthy.

WRITING.TITLE: DAE get annoyed by support?
WRITING.TEXT: Support groups are the worst, but also like friends, family, strangers etc who tell me they #8221;understand me and are there for me #8221; etc. - i hate it. It doesnt help, i only get annoyed and frustrated. I always end up telling lies like how it means a lot to me, but it doesnt mean shit. It only makes them feel better. I feel like usually they dont understand, and when they do, it doesnt help me at all. How does it help if someone feels empathy towards me? Anyone else feel the same?

I was 19 when i was diagnosed, and now im 25. Life has always been hard, but now thanks to 6 years of very successfull therapy it #8217;s a bit easier. Still in therapy though, and i will be probably for pretty long time. I havent been in school or work in 6 years either.

Sounds kinda same as what i do, but turned out my #8221;everything is okay #8221; attitude is actually dissociation and depression. Like a constant autopilot. And it does feel a bit better, that #8217;s why i do it, only problem is when you recover from dissociation and depression the bpd waits there. And if you dont recover, life becomes meaningless, boring, and you dont know where you are. That #8217;s not better than bpd, it #8217;s just different torture. But if yours is actually just change of perspective and not what it was for me, then good for you.

I #8217;ve been 6 years in successfull therapy, and it does get better. It #8217;s not good yet, but i have a lot more than just bpd so that explains it. But yeah for me bpd diagnosis was not disaster, it was relief. Finally an explanation for why do i feel this way, and that it most likely will not be this hard for the rest of my life.

Yes. I #8217;ve had many personalities, and gotten inspiration from things like series and movies. Last time i had friends i had personality that was inspired by harley quinn and hannibal (the series), it was idk 7-10 years ago and it #8217;s funny when i see those people it still automatically goes on. Like i dont actually like red wine, but when im with them i do like it. I also was funny, happy, outgoing, and liked to see other people. But when i got bored to that personality, i also didnt see my friends anymore. With my ex i was kinda shy, childish, let him take care of me (because he liked it), and was afraid of people. Then when im alone im just like who the fuck am i. I feel like #8221;reinventing #8221; myself is not good for recovering, but if i try to #8221;find #8221; who i am im just.. idk empty? Im like a restaurant and i #8217;ll give people the personality they seem like they want to order. But i have a whole menu of them. If that makes sense.

Keep your boundaries. Do not bend them to avoid her getting mad. If you need to or you want to go to sleep even though she still wants to talk, you #8217;re allowed to. That #8217;s how it is in normal friendships. If she cant handle it, she has to talk to a therapist or someone about it, you should not have to walk on eggshells and fulfill her every need. That #8217;s not what friendships are for. And in my experience, when you break your boundaries constantly to fulfill someone elses (bottomless) needs, you end up treating yourself badly and it still wont #8221;fix #8221; the other person. In my case i was walking on eggshells too, and every day i had to be more careful. It was kinda teaching him the wrong message too. But im sorry you #8217;re in that situation, i know it sucks. I hope she has some professional, like therapist, that can help her to get better.

I understand it #8217;s hard. But you cant blame someone for not understanding, if you dont tell them. Sometimes people with bpd expect that our partners read our minds and fulfill our needs without us asking them, or telling them what to do. That #8217;s not actually how relationships work, that #8217;s how parent-child thing works. And your not a child, they are not your parent. I know it #8217;s hard, but if you dont talk to them about it, you cant expect them to understand. And if you dont tell how you feel, you also most likely will hold some grudge towards them that will sabotage your relationship. Is it possible that you #8217;ll tell them how you feel? And what it was that made you feel that way?

I cant form deep connections with anyone. I have had a lot of friends, but even though i saw them often, we had fun, they told me we #8217;re close etc, i didnt feel close to them or any connection. If i never see them again im actually relieved.

I have bpd, and i dated someone with bpd. Maybe it #8217;s different if both have been in therapy, but i had been two years when we started dating and he was only diagnosed after we had dated three years. It was absolute hell, last year of our relationship i stayed because he had abused me and reminded me sometimes that if i even planned of leaving him he would kill me. I only left after he threatened to kill my family (especially said my 4 year old sister) and he was dumb enough to text me about it so i got screenshots and went to the police. But people are different, even with bpd, not everyone is abusive and some have their problems more in control than others. I think there are good and bad relationships, with people who both have bpd, one has bpd, or both are #8221;healthy #8221;. It depends more about other things than just one diagnosis.

Yeah i #8217;ve been in that situation. First i was a gf, then also a mother, therapist, everything. When we broke up i stayed as a #8221;friend #8221; because even though i was over him he still depended on me to be there for him. But i wasnt a friend, i was still a mother and a therapist for him. It #8217;s endless cycle where you think you help them, but it #8217;s actually how you get worse yourself and they stay the same. They need professional help, and you need to keep yourself safe. Many bpd patients are emotionally very hard even for professionals, so to us who have no actual training how to deal with them (or maybe i should say us, i have bpd too) and with the stress it causes, it #8217;s impossible.

Im here because i was born and im afraid that it #8217;s kinda rude to kill myself. And suicide is a big decision, it #8217;s easier to just not do it. But i still dont have any specific reason to be here. I just am, i #8217;ve accepted that i have to be, but im not very excited about it tbh.

Yes, and i think for me it #8217;s maybe because i #8217;ve had anxiety and bad self esteem as long as i can remember, like literally, my first memory is when i was almost three i think and i felt like i was wrong and disgusting. Not hating myself is kinda new thing, and i dont know what it #8217;s like so im afraid to go there.

You need to explain the situation more. Now it just sounds like some girl told someone that she likes them? And though i understand how bad it feels if you like that person, she didnt do anything wrong (if i understood the situation correctly).
Same. I have friends, i have had a lot more friends, and they have told me we are close. But i have never felt that way.

Yes, i dont want to live together with my bf even though he wants to. I also sometimes pay his meal or buy food, socks, etc for him, but i dont want him to buy me anything. I dont want to feel like he does anything for me, i want to be independent to the point where it #8217;s not probably healthy anymore. I think it #8217;s because if he leaves me, it will feel like i lose #8221;less #8221;. He once bought me a coke and i always remember that when i buy coke, so if he is more involved in my life i #8217;ll never be able to get over him when he finally leaves. And i also kinda dont like the feeling when he says im his gf. I feel like a side salad.

Did you tell them your side? It doesnt work if you dont tell her if you think she is wrong, or if you dont feel better. Being honest is the key in therapy, i sometimes look better ( usually in the beginning of my eating disorder, the honeymoon phase, i look happy, excited, etc )and it doesnt mean im #8221;better #8221; im just excited about losing weight in very unhealthy ways, so i always need to tell her that so she wont think im doing better when im not.
If you actually have bpd, you cant just #8221;change #8221;, you need professional help. It is possible to change, but it usually takes years of therapy and hard work.

It #8217;s different for everyone i guess. I always get better when im left alone, i have never felt close with people so i only see them when im doing better. But again it #8217;s different for everyone, you could ask them if they know what #8217;s helpful for them.
But even when they really are there for me, and i of course appreciate it, it still just annoys me. I dont want them to be, and it doesnt really help me in any way.

I left him, and we #8217;re not in contact. He reached out for me like a month ago but i told him i dont want to see him. He had abused me few times when we were together, and when we broke up if i didnt answer to his calls or texts immediatly, he started to threaten me with things like how he is going to kill himself now, or he is going to kill me, or the guy im seeing, etc. I ended it when he texted me he is going to kill my 4 year old sister and explained how he would do it. I was afraid to go home every night, because he sometimes waited in front of my building. My new bf pretty much helped me to go to the police, about threaths and one abuse (i had gone to the doctor after that time so they have evidence). I should have had ended things before it got to that point, but i felt like i wanted to be there for him.
I feel like that too, but i dont know if it #8217;s my avpd or bpd that makes it impossible. Probably both.

I dont understand what you mean by #8221;after all nobody can really help you but yourself #8221;. When you #8217;re in therapy, you are the one doing the work. But the educated professional is there to point out your disorted thinking etc. I mean if you could just #8221;stop #8221;, why havent you? Why did you start going to therapy? If you feel like you dont need it, you #8217;re allowed to stop going. But if you have felt like you need help from outside, maybe this is normal frustration that is part of therapy, or wrong therapist? Couple months in therapy is very short time. When i started, i went twice a week and i #8217;ve been there 6 years, and now i can see the progress.

Have you talked with your therapist about this? For me being self aware doesnt mean i can always stop behaving like i do, but of course it is different for everyone. I think your therapist knows better, than for example i do, if your progress is enough for you to survive on your own, or what is causing you to feel like you explained, and so on. So i would advice you to ask them if that #8217;s possible

I never answer to calls, except if it #8217;s a family member, bf, or like if im waiting a call from a doctor. If it #8217;s some random friend or relative i just wait and let it end, then 10minutes after text them back.

Actually no, i have a loving family who was always there for me, lots of younger siblings, i always had friends as a kid, etc. I liked to play alone as a kid, but people just came into my life. Everyone reached out for me and i didnt like it. Like always i told some of my friends from school that they cant come over, then they asked my mom or my little sister, came over, and came to play with me. I #8217;ve always wanted to be alone as long as i can remember. I was friendly, happy, nice, good social skills, etc when in public, but it was a role because for some reason i though you have to be these things. I still struggle with people wanting to be friends with me, and old friends calling and texting me and telling me they want to see me. One of my ex friends broke up with her bf and told me she has no one else so i have to see her now. But i dont really want to. I have empathy for her but i hate myself when im with people.

I ignore them, dissociate to escape, then cut myself when im alone. And it doesnt matter if someone is mean to me, or i see someone being mean to someone else, it still usually goes this way. So in a nutshell, i dont handle them well.

I have avpd but also bpd, so imo that explains why im not #8221;stereotypical #8221; avpd. But i have looked into Schizoid, and it doesnt fit, i #8217;ve done a lot of personality disorder tests and i #8217;ve been in therapy over 6 years, i believe my diangoses are correct. My mom had depression and was very unstable like 2-3 years when i was born, so that according to my therapist can explain why i have always hated myself so much. Even as a child i felt like i was disgusting, and that was the main reason i wanted to be alone.

You #8217;re not abandoning them, you broke up and you need to move on. That #8217;s how normal relationships and end of relationships work. You #8217;re not her doctor or therapist. And very weird comment from her mom, i think she is feeling helpless when she cant help her daughter or something, and thinks if you #8221;come back #8221; her daughter will get better. But that #8217;s not really how it goes. Only a therapist can help with bpd. And her mother is there for her, so she is not alone. I have been in that situation, and i stayed. Worst decision of my life, made both of us worse. Tell her that you need your space, and that you would appreciate if she gave that to you. If she still texts you, say it again and after that dont answer. I know it feels rude, but it #8217;s actually her being rude if she #8217;s not accepting that you have a right to move on. I know you have empathy for her, but you still have to have empathy for yourself. You have a right to keep boundaries, and if that relationship is too much for you, you have a right to end it.

I mean personality disorders are never the same with everyone, but i feel like most of this fits me perfectly. Also i dont constantly self isolate, but mostly i do, not because i dont want to connect people but because i hate myself 10x more when im with them. I know i have good social skills because others have told me that, yet i feel always like im wrong kind or dont fit, and i feel especially negative emptions very intensly. That #8217;s not schizoid as far as i know. But im curious, why do you think im opposite of avpd? Everything in this list fits me for example: https://www.verywellmind.com/avoidant-personality-disorder-4172959

I have bpd, and i too have never yelled to my therapist or fired her etc. Bpd is different with everyone, and it #8217;s pretty clear that therapists you #8217;ve seen are not good to treat you. I dont know how to help you, other than tell you that you need to find some professional who will have you fill the personality disorder tests.

Mielenkiintosen vaikeeks tehty toi haku homma. Itell #228; k #228;vi tuuri, kun k #228;vin p #228;iv #228;osastolla jonkin aikaa ennen psykoterapeutin etsint #228; #228;, ja siell #228; oli yksi joka sitten sanoi ett #228; on psykoterapeuttina yksityisell #228; puolellakin, ja voi ottaa sinne asiakkaaksi. Persoonallisuush #228;iri #246;ist #228; johtuen, ja pahan masennuksen, sy #246;mish #228;iri #246;n yms takia en ollut saanut kehenk #228; #228;n otettua yhteytt #228;, enk #228; varmaan olisi saanut otettuakaan. Suurin ongelma itsell #228; oli voimattomuus, ei jaksanut olla edes koulussa, asioita ei saa hoidettua, niin suuri itseinho ettei mm puhelinsoitoista tai ihmiskontakteista tule oikein mit #228; #228;n, ja sitten k #228;skettiin #8221;ottaa yhteytt #228; useampaan terapeuttiin ja katsoa jos sopii yhteen #8221;. Tosi realistista. Muuten positiivisia kokemuksia kelalta, kyseinen terapeutti ei kuulunut johonkin #8221;sopimuspiiriin #8221;, mutta tehtiin erillissopimus.

YES. Thing is i dont make a lot of money because i #8217;ve been on a temporary retirement for last 6 years, but I still always try to pay for my bf food when were ordering something, or in a restaurant, or in a grocery store, etc. I also try to but his socks, boxers, etc even though i cant really afford to. I liked it at first. I used it as an escape from situations where i was bullied, and also every time i felt overwhelming shame, guilt, etc. It was very nice, helpful and just great thing to have, saved me from a lot of pain. But now that im trying to recover, it #8217;s not helpful anymore. I dont need it and i can manage even my #8221;hardest #8221; feelings without it, but it #8217;s so automatic and hard to turn off. It hits me like a fucking lightning and i cant function. Sometimes i have to pull over when im driving, because i feel it #8217;s starting. Im either not there anymore, or i feel like im 12 year old kid who is really scared. When i was walking to the psychiatric clinic, that is 5 minutes away from my house, i got lost. I #8217;ve been going there over 4 years, and i had to google where it is. Cant find places even at my own apartment sometimes, i tried to go get something to eat and i #8221;woke up #8221; staring at the wall in my bathroom. Im constantly afraid about being late, because some times 5 minutes is 1 minute, and sometimes it #8217;s a whole day. It #8217;s different for everyone but i dont like mine, i just dont know how to unsubscribe this damn thing.

If you #8217;ve had mental health problems for long time, it usually also takes a long time to heal from them. In my experience 2-3 months is very short time for therapy, and if you are feeling like you #8217;re not okay you should continue it. It #8217;s not like going to a doctor few times and you #8217;re healed, it #8217;s a process and there will be better and worse times.

Yeah i know the feeling. But (again, just in my experience) unnecessary guilt was excellent thing to process in therapy, and it #8217;s better to go as soon as you feel you #8217;re not okay, because problems usually get worse by time. But i also understand it #8217;s hard, and it #8217;s easier to say things than to do them. So i hope you go when you feel ready, and i also hope that it gets better.

It was hell and every day i thank god i got out alive. We had good days too, but so does every abusive and toxic relationship. Probably depends on how much you can both control yourself, selfawarness, if therapy is helping, etc.

I dont keep it as a secret, i #8217;ve told about it for like random relatives, told my teachers when i still was in school, bf, some of his friends when it came up, etc, but usually most of them dont even know what it is.

I cut myself sometimes if im sad or numb, but also if i need to feel like im in control. And I use it as a grounding method when im dissociating, and i need to #8221;come back #8221; quickly. I also reward myself with it when i have to see people i dont like. It #8217;s like a little secret that keeps me going trough the day, i get adrenaline rush for even thinking about it. I validate my feelings with it, and comfort myself. I like the feeling when i have #8221;proof #8221; for my struggles. Like if i say someone im angry or sad, they can be like #8221;yeah everyone is #8221;, but if i cut myself it #8217;s harder to ignore. (I never show my cuts or tell about them to anyone though). But it #8217;s really not helpful, and that #8217;s why i use more good coping mechanisms these days. I can clearly see how cutting at least in my experience just is digging the hole more deeper. Not helping me out of it. But still i get the urges sometimes.

WRITING.TITLE: Were you like this as a kid?
WRITING.TEXT: I know kids cant really have personality disorders, but did you have traits of it as a kid? Does it always start at very young age or? When i was 20 and told my mom i was diagnosed with bpd, she pretty much yelled #8221;bingo #8221; because it fits so well and explains my whole childhood and teenage years. My sister told me that it explains why i always did stuff like asked if she wants to play with bratz dolls, we happily go found our dolls etc, then 2 minutes and i say i dont feel like playing. She then asks why, and i get so mad, yell at her, and throw stuff and run out crying.

I mean the problem was that i was always very well behaving child. Nicest, friendliest, never in trouble, always did as adults told to, etc. I have #8221;quiet #8221; bpd so they only saw my most radical mood swings, but it wasnt so obvious that something was wrong. It looked a lot like just normal defiance that kids and teens have. So they didnt have a reason to improve my behaviour, it was just that often when it was just our family i suddenly went from 0 to 100 and then wanted to be alone. Like withou a reason. I #8217;ve also had avpd traits as long as i can remember, so i never told mom if i had stomach pain or anything, i kept everything as a secret.

I have to ask what you mean by #8221;cant be mentally ill until they #8217;re 14 #8221;? According to my psychotherapist it #8217;s possible even for a baby to be depressed if mom is. And of course kids can be depressed, have anxiety, ptsd, etc? But yes with personality disorders, they usually cant be diagnosed before the person is adult, though there of course are signs and traits before they #8217;re diagnosed. Sorry, I probably misunderstood what your saying or something

I always forgave him immediatly, didnt even try to defend myself in any way. Just was there waiting to pass out when he choked me and yelled at me that im stupid whore, and when i woke up he already usually told me he #8217;s sorry and i was like #8221;it #8217;s okay #8221;. Not always, but sometimes i get moments when i feel like they understand and i feel connected. But with bpd the important thing is for you to give yourself the understanding you crave. There is no #8221;quick fix #8221;. For me therapy is helpful, and i #8217;ve been going for over 6 years now and it #8217;s really getting better. Still hell, but when i look back i can see the change. So i cant help. Before therapy, i tried all sorts of things and ended up developing eating disorder, depression, and dissociation as my #8221;coping mechanisms #8221; (also used all sorts of self harm methods) and i cant recommend anything other than therapy. Really dont believe there is a #8221;quick fix #8221; to personality disorders.

We were friends at first, then started dating because i had hard time saying no and he was very very very determined. He also one day came to my place and said he wont leave, and that #8217;s how we started living together. For three years. He had alcohol and drug problems, he physically abused me few times, stalked me, told me he will kill me if i left him, he stole money from me, when we broke up finally for good he called me every day like 2-20 times and sent me messages where he told me he will kill my 4 year old sister if i wont answer. He also grow cannabis at my place, crashed my fathers car (i wasnt allowed to give it to anyone, but he told me he #8217;ll hit me if he cant take it) and stuff like that. Every week new theme. Constant rollercoaster. We both have bpd, im kinda empty quiet one who had trouble with keeping boundaries, he was aggressive and impulsive who didnt want me to have boundaries. Match made in hell.

I know they did mistakes, but neither of them is (or was) unstable. Mom had depression like first two or three years of my life, and according to my therapist that can have a huge impact on a child. Neither of them used alcohol, and mom went to therapy when she was depressed, and it helped her. According to my psychotherapist (that i #8217;ve seen over 6 years), psychologist, doctors, etc, my parents are stable and #8221;healthy #8221;, and my personality is very #8221;needy #8221; (dont mean in rude way, but it #8217;s the truth) and i #8217;ve always been very sensitive, which is why moms depression (and traumas unrelated to my parents) made me this way. Im 25 and dont believe my parents are heroes. Still im aware that they have never been abusive and have been good parents. Not everyone with avpd or bpd has it because parents were abusive. That #8217;s a stereotype. (And out of the 6 kids they have, im the only one who is fucked up)

He started therapy before we broke up and i hope it helps and that he keeps going there, but yeah he was dangerous to others and to himself too and made me a lot worse while we were together. So in a nutshell my experience with people who have bpd too is that it #8217;s twice as hard when you #8217;re both struggling. But maybe when you #8217;re both in therapy and a lot better already, in theory it could be a good thing.

Yeah im afraid of that. But then i look back for example when i started going to therapy, and i can see how much i #8217;ve grown and healed. It felt impossible back then, and it #8217;s only a small victory, but still it #8217;s a great thing and i try to focus on finding those instead of focusing on my fears.

WRITING.TITLE: Bf cheated and idk how much
WRITING.TEXT: I used to ignore all the #8221;my bf is cheating on me #8221; feelings, and believed it #8217;s just my BPD. Then he got caught, he was texting with his ex some sexual stuff. He says they never met, just sent pictures once. I saw the signs, but ignored them. He acted guilty, did the dishes, took the trash out, etc a lot. But i was like #8221;haha my stupid imagination #8221;. So now im having those vibes again. Not that he #8217;s cheating, but that he lied about it. His ex had left a perfume at his place when they broke up, and now i cant find it at his place. It was there for like 6 months and was almost unused, so i started using it, that #8217;s why im sure he didnt throw it away. He said they didnt see each other, but i have a feeling they did and she either took the perfume or he gave it back to her. Asking would be most mature thing to do, problem is i have no way of knowing if he #8217;s telling the truth. If he shows it to me, or says he threw it away, or if i go looking it on my own, i feel like im batshit crazy. No matter what i do i feel like im overreacting because of BPD. What should i do?

I feel confused when he cheated, because i #8217;ve always told we can have open relationship or even just have sex and nothing more, and it was him who wanted and still wants more. And this is more like me obsessing about wanting to know the whole truth and not so much if i can trust him. Because everyone lies, it just varies about what and how much.

Oh okay. I think not everyone raises their voice when angry (at least not radically) so he could still feel anger just show it only as frustration and aggrivation. It #8217;s usually a message that your needs are not met and stuff like that, so as a feeling it #8217;s a good thing, but when you let it out too radically it becomes a problem. But you shouldnt feel bad for feeling angry sometimes, in my experience it #8217;s a feeling that tries to protect you.

Also dont want to feel like the im #8221;crazy BPD bitch #8221; so maybe i #8217;ll just try to forget about it. Just dont know how.
Im always so deep in #8221;everyone will abandon me so i #8217;ll do it first #8221; that there isnt anyone who has abandoned me.

I can assure you that this is not better than caring too much, i cant emotionally connect with anyone and feel just empty and cold when im with people. I dont miss people but i miss missing people if that makes sense. I hope we both get better eventually

1. Im very aware, that #8217;s why i dont show any of my real emotions to people and i just show them what they want to see or what i think is #8221;right #8221; to feel at that situation. 2. I had bad depression few years back, no idea how it was different. But now i sometimes have weeks when i get very high points in depression tests, then two weeks and im not depressed at all. I guess for me it comes and goes more easily than for someone that doesnt have BPD. 3. I had been making myself throw up like few months, and went to get help. Turned out my PDs had gotten me few other illnesses like severe depression, ptsd and eating disorder. Those had #8221;signs #8221; so i knew i needed help, AvPD and BPD were suprises. 4. Yes but i also feel intense pain when i dont lose anyone. Like only seeing my family reminds me every time about how they #8217;re going to die and i #8217;ll lose them, so breaking up was a relief last time, one less person to worry about. When im not close with people, the pain of fearing abandonment is also not constantly there. Im relieved when relationship or friendship ends, and even when a person close to me dies. It means i cant fuck it up anymore.

WRITING.TITLE: Having good social skills, but feeling like you dont?
WRITING.TEXT: Does anyone else struggle with social skills, but no one can tell? I always feel like i dont belong, im different, somehow wrong kind, disgusting, and being with people takes a lot of energy and effort. Family and friends, even random people, describe me as happy, friendly, confident, funny, #8221;life of the party #8221; even. I dont have what i think #8221;friends #8221; are supposed to be and feel like, i have people who consider me as a friend though. But for me they are more like an audience and i dont know how to be #8221;real #8221; with them, even if i share personal things with them there #8217;s this huge gap between us. Can anyone relate to what i explained? Kinda knowing how to mimic having good social skills, but still struggle with social situations? Like it always takes extra effort or something?

Of course i cant know the whole situation, but based on the things you told, imo they #8217;re not toxic, and you #8217;re not asshole. I too would not probably be able to be friends with someone if they told me they have feelings for me, because it can be very akward and i felt like i was giving them false hope. But you #8217;re of course allowed to not be in touch with them, and i even think it could be better that way. I mean if i get feelings for someone, it never really goes away and being just friends with someone you secretly have feelings or sort of small crush for is (again at least in my experience) kinda torture.
I #8217;ve only dated two guys, both were taller than me, but i would not mind if the guy was shorter. I even feel like it would be hot if the guy was shorter than me tbh.

In my case it would be because i cant know if they make a move again, or really are #8221;over #8221; me. The guy said he was, turned out he wasnt. He was just fooling himself, and me acting like everything is like it used to be was actually torturing him. So if it happened again, i wouldnt be comfortable. I would all the time be looking at my own actions so that im not distant but im also not sending mixed messages. Couldnt be my normal self with that person, i would have to act differently and i would be afraid they #8217;ll notice and take it in a bad way. Of course it #8217;s different for everyone, someone in my situation would be able to act the same and see no problem with the whole thing. But some people are more sensitive with these things.

I never felt the need to hurt an animal, but i fantasised killing people a lot. I have AvPD and BPD (quiet type) and i seem like the nicest person you can meet probably. I was bullied as a kid, so when i went to next school i took the role of popular funny nice kid but i was still deeply afraid of people. So i was constantly afraid of everyone, when going to school, seeing friends, going to grocery store, using the bus, etc i was full adrenaline and just terrified and no one could tell. I couldnt avoid people, so thinking about killing them kinda made me feel a bit better and safer. Thoughts started maybe when i was 16. I also had plans how would i do it if i killed someone so it could look like an accident and so on, but i dont think i would ever had done it. Therapy helped with it quickly, they took me out from school, put me in temporary retirement (i still am on it after 6 years) and helped me to calm down. Turned out i was just constantly living trough my traumas when i was with people, and i also have ptsd so those thoughts were because i felt i was in danger and couldnt escape.
